tls:text.tls:line: Well conscious of afflictions,
Well conscious of afflictions,

sense.def: BUDDH: afflictions; troubles, defilements, contamination (SOOTHILL: 406 "The Chinese interpretation is the delusions, trials, or temptations of the passions and of ignorance which disturb and distress the mind [...].") (The three basic defilements are also referred to as the Three Poisons' of craving/passion (tān 貪 ), anger/aversion (chēn 嗔 ), and ignorance (chi 痴 )) skr. kleśa

tls:text.tls:line: one should manifest happiness of mind.
one should manifest happiness of mind.
one should manifest happiness of mind.
one should manifest happiness of mind.
one should manifest happiness of mind.

sense.def: frame of mind > 億萬心, 一心 mentality; preferences; psychological attitude; inclination; motivation; motives[Note that this meaning sometimes does verge towards nab-disp.]

tls:text.tls:line: Listen now to what I have collected,
Listen now to what I have collected,
the odes of the law proclaimed by Buddha.

sense.def: make public; pronounce publicly; announce publicly; proclaim

tls:text.tls:line: the odes of the law proclaimed by Buddha.
Thus Buddha, the world-honoured One,
the master of all knowledge,

sense.def: kinds of wisdom; parts of relevant knowledge

tls:text.tls:line: in his compassion for sentient beings

sense.def: be compassionate, be merciful towards others

tls:text.tls:line: in his compassion for sentient beings

sense.def: BUDDH: endowed with sensation > sentient being (as opposed to 無情 inanimate things) (this term for sattva was introduced by Xuánzàng 玄奘 (600-664), although the older term zhòngshēng 眾生 remained more popular; originally both terms were a translation of the same Sanskrit word but eventually yǒuqíng came to be used paricularily for creatures with mental activities, whereas zhòngshēng can be used more generally for 'living being', including plant life; the term yǒuqíng is also less neutral, since it gives also emphasis to the notion of qíng 情, i.e. that living beings (particularily human beings) are characterized by deluded mental activities); SANSKRIT sattva

tls:text.tls:line: widely expounded the words of truth.

sense.def: widely; broadly; on a broad scale; in a wide-ranging manner

tls:text.tls:line: widely expounded the words of truth.
widely expounded the words of truth.

sense.def: what is said > discourse (this can refer to spoken word and the written word); message

tls:text.tls:line: All formations are impermanent.

sense.def: Charles Willemen Udānavarga p. 5, note 1a: formations: the formed, scilicet by pre-existing causes

tls:text.tls:line: All formations are impermanent.
They are all of the nature that they rise and pass away.
They are all of the nature that they rise and pass away.
Now, come into being, they suddenly turn toward their end.

sense.def: "Now,", "In fact," introducing new subject for the discourse, and introducing non-narrative theoretical discourse.

tls:text.tls:line: Now, come into being, they suddenly turn toward their end.

sense.def: the living, those who are alive; living creatures

tls:text.tls:line: Now, come into being, they suddenly turn toward their end.

sense.def: (always) at once, invariably without delay, without exception

tls:text.tls:line: Now, come into being, they suddenly turn toward their end.

sense.def: again (to be read hái since when???)

tls:text.tls:line: Now, come into being, they suddenly turn toward their end.

sense.def: come to an end, finish; bring things to a close

tls:text.tls:line: Calmness means utmost happiness.

sense.def: BUDDH: peace and extinction, destruction (of defilements); cessation (used as descriptive syn. to nirvāṇa 涅槃; skr. nirvṛti, pali nibbuti)

tls:text.tls:line: Calmness means utmost happiness.

sense.def: be in a peaceful happy state 最安樂

tls:text.tls:line: When such a torch is ablaze
When such a torch is ablaze
discarded objects are in a dark place.
If one does not take pains to search with the lamp of wisdom
If one does not take pains to search with the lamp of wisdom

sense.def: lamp (as help of orientation for others)

tls:text.tls:line: Man's body consists of parts,
Man's body consists of parts,
lying in all directions.
lying in all directions.
The skeleton is pigeon-coloured.
The skeleton is pigeon-coloured.
When contemplating it, what happiness would there be?

sense.def: deep communicative happiness 熱鬧的快樂

tls:text.tls:line: When contemplating it, what happiness would there be?

sense.def: joyful satisfaction; state of delight or happiness; joyfulness; joy, delight; happiness;

tls:text.tls:line: It is thus: the first night man dwells
He daily passes through many changes.

sense.def: daily, every day; day in and day out; progressively generally: all the time

tls:text.tls:line: He daily passes through many changes.

sense.def: numerous, a great many, many; much; a lot of; a large number of

tls:text.tls:line: He daily passes through many changes.
Once gone he definitely will not return.
Once gone he definitely will not return.
Once gone he definitely will not return.
In the morning one may see an excellent thing,

sense.def: comely, handsome; good to look at

tls:text.tls:line: In the morning one may see an excellent thing,

sense.def: see clearly, make out, catch sight of; notice, perceive; be able to recognise

tls:text.tls:line: but once night has fallen it is invisible.
What one has looked upon yesterday,
What one has looked upon yesterday,
this evening may not exist.

sense.def: OBI: present, contemporary; in the present sequence of days/months

tls:text.tls:line: this evening may not exist.

sense.def: conceivably; probably, quite possibly, in all likelihood; "before you know it"; by any chance

tls:text.tls:line: this evening may not exist.

sense.def: be absent; not exist; be lacking

tls:text.tls:line: Prosperity may be abundantly brilliant,

sense.def: prosperity (as happiness??? This term may be usefully compared to those of happiness and properly belongs into the Synonym Group RICH)

tls:text.tls:line: Prosperity may be abundantly brilliant,
but it is impermanent and has no fixed duration.
but it is impermanent and has no fixed duration.
without discrimination both the noble and the mean

sense.def: making no choice between; indiscriminately, all

tls:text.tls:line: are continually crushed by the king of death.
are continually crushed by the king of death.

sense.def: passive marker be V-ed by N (note: 被死相隨)

tls:text.tls:line: are continually crushed by the king of death.
Some die in the womb

sense.def: on occasion; sometimes; sometimes (...but at other times...); one moment, (and at another moment...)

tls:text.tls:line: Some die in the womb
Some die in the womb
and some die at birth.

sense.def: on occasion; sometimes; sometimes (...but at other times...); one moment, (and at another moment...)

tls:text.tls:line: and some die at birth.

sense.def: as soon as, just 初生 "when he was just born, as soon as he is born, from birth"

tls:text.tls:line: and some die at birth.
and the aged accept it with resignation.
and the aged accept it with resignation.
and the aged accept it with resignation.
Aged or young,
Aged or young,
and middle-aged too
they are constantly encroached upon by death.

sense.def: constantly, regularly; continuously; constantly and at regular intervals

tls:text.tls:line: they are constantly encroached upon by death.
they are constantly encroached upon by death.
How could one not be afraid?
How could one not be afraid?
Life is like a fruit that ripens by itself.
Life is like a fruit that ripens by itself.
Life is like a fruit that ripens by itself.
Life is like a fruit that ripens by itself.

sense.def: in the natural course of events; naturally; automatically; spontaneously; by itself (without any external initiative)

tls:text.tls:line: Life is like a fruit that ripens by itself.
One is always afraid that it might fall.

sense.def: regularly; invariably; in perpetuity; permanently, constantly

tls:text.tls:line: One is always afraid that it might fall.
One is always afraid that it might fall.
Once it comes into being, it will surely have an end.
Once it comes into being, it will surely have an end.

sense.def: when; after S1, S2 (yǐ marks the relative temporal anteriority of an event; compare liǎo 了 and bì 畢 in this function) Compare also 已了 as an expanded form of considerable analytic interest.

tls:text.tls:line: Once it comes into being, it will surely have an end.
Who can avoid this.

sense.def: avoid (something); try to keep away from; keep away from

tls:text.tls:line: When for instance a master-potter
makes unburnt earthenware with diluted clay (CH)
it will all be broken.
it will all be broken.
it will all be broken.
With man's life it is thus too.

sense.def: fated life of men, human life

tls:text.tls:line: When for instance someone plays the lute
When for instance someone plays the lute
it produces a multitude of subtle notes,

sense.def: provide a large or sufficient amount of N

tls:text.tls:line: it produces a multitude of subtle notes,
but if a string is broken it does not produce a bit of sound.
but if a string is broken it does not produce a bit of sound.

sense.def: get broken (not necessarily "be broken by someone".)

tls:text.tls:line: but if a string is broken it does not produce a bit of sound.

sense.def: slight; of small amount; after negatives: the slightest amount

tls:text.tls:line: With man's life it is thus too.

sense.def: fated life of men, human life

tls:text.tls:line: As a prisoner who is tied up
As a prisoner who is tied up
As a prisoner who is tied up

sense.def: being put into fetters; being tied up

tls:text.tls:line: and dragged to the market place
and dragged to the market place
and dragged to the market place
his every move directed to the path of death,
his every move directed to the path of death,

sense.def: death, also abstract: the fact of dying; mode of dying

tls:text.tls:line: so too is life's fate.
As a river which swiftly flows, (The Yellow River CH)

sense.def: go on and on; keep going

tls:text.tls:line: As a river which swiftly flows, (The Yellow River CH)
As a river which swiftly flows, (The Yellow River CH)
and, once gone, will in no way return,

sense.def: make an about turn and withdraw, turn back, head back; turn round in order to withdraw or return to where one comes from, or retrace one's steps

tls:text.tls:line: so to is man's life.
Those who are gone will by no means come back.
Those who are gone will by no means come back.
and bring about much suffering.
and bring about much suffering.
With a man's life it is thus too.

sense.def: fated life of men, human life

tls:text.tls:line: By old age and death it is waylaid.
By old age and death it is waylaid.
By old age and death it is waylaid.

sense.def: death, also abstract: the fact of dying; mode of dying

tls:text.tls:line: By old age and death it is waylaid.
Through the merits one has achieved
Through the merits one has achieved
one obtains happiness for a long time,

sense.def: obtain through effort, get hold of

tls:text.tls:line: one obtains happiness for a long time,
but it is like striking running water with a staff.
but it is like striking running water with a staff.

sense.def: strike, beat (e.g. a dog, a horse, one's breast, or indeed a bell)

tls:text.tls:line: but it is like striking running water with a staff.
but it is like striking running water with a staff.
but it is like striking running water with a staff.
For a while the waters part but still they are close once more.

sense.def: for a short while; for the time being

tls:text.tls:line: For a while the waters part but still they are close once more.
For a while the waters part but still they are close once more.

sense.def: again (to be read hái since when???)

tls:text.tls:line: For a while the waters part but still they are close once more.
As cattle which are tended, [As when a man holding a stick walks along CH]

sense.def: hold in one's hands and be in charge of; hold and carry along (objects with or without a handle)

tls:text.tls:line: As cattle which are tended, [As when a man holding a stick walks along CH]
As cattle which are tended, [As when a man holding a stick walks along CH]

sense.def: walk, take a walk; travel; be on the move; go on a tour of inspection; walk along

tls:text.tls:line: grazed and watered by a man who walks holding a stick
grazed and watered by a man who walks holding a stick

sense.def: give something to drink (also to horses and dragons)

tls:text.tls:line: grazed and watered by a man who walks holding a stick

sense.def: give something to eat to (a person or sometimes an animal); provide for the subsistene of

tls:text.tls:line: grazed and watered by a man who walks holding a stick

sense.def: (an N) which (V-s) 葉實可啄食者 SW: 凡物無乳者

tls:text.tls:line: so too is man's life.

sense.def: fated life of men, human life

tls:text.tls:line: Man also goes on nurturing life.

sense.def: go along V-ing; keep on V-ing?????

tls:text.tls:line: he must not idly pass night and day!

sense.def: during day and night > all day and night

tls:text.tls:line: he must not idly pass night and day!

sense.def: to no effect, with no result

tls:text.tls:line: Having obtained a human body,
Having obtained a human body,

sense.def: BUDDH: incarnation as a human being; human life

tls:text.tls:line: he must whole-heartedly think that his life will end.

sense.def: with one's whole heart > whole-heartedly, single-mindedly, (GERMAN von ganzer Seele, mit Herz und Seele)

tls:text.tls:line: he must whole-heartedly think that his life will end.
he must whole-heartedly think that his life will end.

sense.def: be exhausted so as to come to an end

tls:text.tls:line: To him who does not sleep soundly the night seems long.
To him who does not sleep soundly the night seems long.
to him who is tired the road seems long.

sense.def: be worn out; be tired out

tls:text.tls:line: to him who is tired the road seems long.

sense.def: travelling a long distance; long distance

tls:text.tls:line: For the foolish confused person (the cycle of) life and death are everlasting.

sense.def: BUDDH: the cycle of life of death, transmigration (other translations include lúnhuí 輪迴; the destinations of these transmigrations do not only include human life but also other forms of existence in the liùdào 六道 Six Destinations, such as God (deva), human being (manuṣya). demon or demigod (asura 阿修羅), animal (tiryagyoni 畜生), hungry ghost (preta, 餓鬼), or hell-dweller (naraka, 地獄; the destiny of a person is dependent on his deeds (karma, yè 業) in his previous lives) (ant. to 涅槃 nirvāṇa); skr. saṃsāra)

tls:text.tls:line: For the foolish confused person (the cycle of) life and death are everlasting.
Few hear the good law.
Few hear the good law.
Few hear the good law.
He who has a son and riches
though trying to save, will meet with separation and ruin.
though trying to save, will meet with separation and ruin.
The fool does not see this by himself,
but why should one (how can oneCH) rely on having riches and a son?

sense.def: how on earth? How on earth could you/he/I? 回何敢死？ 丘何敢乎？何足憂？

tls:text.tls:line: but why should one (how can oneCH) rely on having riches and a son?

sense.def: put one's confidence in that, rely on (something happening)

tls:text.tls:line: A hundred, a thousand, countless
wealthy men and women of good families
wealthy men and women of good families
amass many possessions,
amass many possessions,
amass many possessions,

sense.def: numerous, a great many, many; much; a lot of; a large number of

tls:text.tls:line: but all perish.
but all perish.
Wealth and honour are not the assets of a sage (CH)

sense.def: great wealth; sometimes more generally: abundant supply of things, signs of wealth

tls:text.tls:line: Wealth and honour are not the assets of a sage (CH)

sense.def: being rich, the state of being wealthy, wealth

tls:text.tls:line: Wealth and honour are not the assets of a sage (CH)
They are constantly waylaid by impermanence,

sense.def: constantly, regularly; continuously; constantly and at regular intervals

tls:text.tls:line: They are constantly waylaid by impermanence,

sense.def: marker of passive 為人戮，為天下笑

tls:text.tls:line: They are constantly waylaid by impermanence,

sense.def: BUDDH: impermanence (one of the key terms in Buddhist philosophy; in early Buddhism attributed to all dharmas except space (空) and nirvāṇa 涅槃; ant. to 常住)

tls:text.tls:line: They are constantly waylaid by impermanence,
like blind people,
unable to see for themselves.
What has been gathered together will be broken up again,

sense.def: accumulated objects; things one has collected or accumulated

tls:text.tls:line: What has been gathered together will be broken up again,

sense.def: again (to be read hái since when???)

tls:text.tls:line: What has been gathered together will be broken up again,
What is high will certainly fall down.
All that has come into existence will come to a complete stop.
All that has come into existence will come to a complete stop.
All that has come into existence will come to a complete stop.
With sentient beings it is thus too.

sense.def: BUDDH: endowed with sensation > sentient being (as opposed to 無情 inanimate things) (this term for sattva was introduced by Xuánzàng 玄奘 (600-664), although the older term zhòngshēng 眾生 remained more popular; originally both terms were a translation of the same Sanskrit word but eventually yǒuqíng came to be used paricularily for creatures with mental activities, whereas zhòngshēng can be used more generally for 'living being', including plant life; the term yǒuqíng is also less neutral, since it gives also emphasis to the notion of qíng 情, i.e. that living beings (particularily human beings) are characterized by deluded mental activities); SANSKRIT sattva

tls:text.tls:line: Evil-doers go to hell.
Evil-doers go to hell.
Evil-doers go to hell.

sense.def: BUDDH: hell (the lowest of the Six Destinations, liùdào 六道, thought to be located somewhere underground); skr. naraka

tls:text.tls:line: If one cultivates what is good, he will be born in heaven.

sense.def: moral excellence in action; acts of goodness

tls:text.tls:line: his biases extinguished he will obtain nirvana.

sense.def: BUDDH: what leaks out > afflictions, impurities Willeman: bias

tls:text.tls:line: his biases extinguished he will obtain nirvana.

sense.def: BUDDH: skr. nirvāṇa (tranquility; the cessation of suffering)

tls:text.tls:line: condition-knowers and truth-hearers (CH)

sense.def: BUDDH: self-enlightened one; one enlightened through causation; SANSKRIT pratyeka-Buddha, referring to somebody who has reached enlightenment by himself (attained alone and without a (Buddhist) teacher); in Mahāyāna texts often described as a realization of an inferior kind and contrasted to the altruistic practice of Bodhisattva (sometimes also referring to Buddha Śākyamuni and his realization of the principle of dependent co-arising, representing Buddha right after his experience of enlightenment and prior to his first sermons given at Benares)

tls:text.tls:line: condition-knowers and truth-hearers (CH)

sense.def: BUDDH: listen to the sound > those who listened to the sermons of the Buddha > disciple of the Buddha (in Mahāyāna Buddhism usually deratory for followers of the Hīnayāna, the 'Small Vehicle'); skr. śrāvaka

tls:text.tls:line: still reject their formed body,
still reject their formed body,

sense.def: give up, release; opt against, reject as a choice; give up on; set aside; throw away

tls:text.tls:line: still reject their formed body,
how much more so must sentient beings.

sense.def: all the NPs [sorry for the tautologous semantic category!]

tls:text.tls:line: Neither in the air no in the sea,
is there a place on earth

sense.def: there is no such thing as N

tls:text.tls:line: where one might escape and not experience death.

sense.def: escape so as to find peace

tls:text.tls:line: Whether dwelling in the present age,
in the past or in the future
in the past or in the future

sense.def: what has not yet come > the future

tls:text.tls:line: in the end all the formed (>deliberate action)
in the end all the formed (>deliberate action)

sense.def: BUDDH: phenomenon (pertaining to the relative truth as opposed to lǐ 理 which points to underlying true nature of things)

tls:text.tls:line: in the end all the formed (>deliberate action)

sense.def: affairs; matter, thing; subject matter (of a painting) 不然之事

tls:text.tls:line: returns in the end to utter destruction. (CH)

sense.def: in the end; to the very end; finally

tls:text.tls:line: returns in the end to utter destruction. (CH)

sense.def: return to 歸于 (where the subject belongs)

tls:text.tls:line: When a wise man has well left behind his fetters
When a wise man has well left behind his fetters
When a wise man has well left behind his fetters

sense.def: rope used to tie up a prisoner

tls:text.tls:line: and constantly contemplates with right attentiveness,

sense.def: constantly, regularly; continuously; constantly and at regular intervals

tls:text.tls:line: and constantly contemplates with right attentiveness,
when he constantly reflects on the path without bias (biasless path)

sense.def: BUDDH: without outflows > untainted, pure, without bias; without contamination (i.e. the absence of passions and delusions) (ant. of yǒulòu 有漏); skr. anāsrava, nirmala, nirāsvara

tls:text.tls:line: such a one (CH) is called a truly wise man.

sense.def: true; genuine, not fake, not only apparent; veritable

tls:text.tls:line: Like unto when a prisoner is tied up, (CH)
Like unto when a prisoner is tied up, (CH)
Like unto when a prisoner is tied up, (CH)

sense.def: being put into fetters; being tied up

tls:text.tls:line: and also like a dilapidated old wagon

sense.def: withered, gone all dry (as of bones)

tls:text.tls:line: and also like a dilapidated old wagon
and also like a dilapidated old wagon
is ruined before long,

sense.def: passivising grammaticalised particle derived from a transitive verb

tls:text.tls:line: beauty turns to old age.

sense.def: female beauty; male or female good looks; sex; sexy looks; female charms

tls:text.tls:line: beauty turns to old age.

sense.def: change from one's original form to become, turn into

tls:text.tls:line: beauty turns to old age.
Being fond of a house is like staying in a prison.

sense.def: post-Han: be devoted to in deep affection

tls:text.tls:line: Being fond of a house is like staying in a prison.
Unexpectedly death strikes,

sense.def: suddenly, before you know it; before you know of it

tls:text.tls:line: Unexpectedly death strikes,
Unexpectedly death strikes,

sense.def: to come in order to V; come so as to V; come for the purpose of Ving

tls:text.tls:line: but the fool is unable to understand this. (CH)
but the fool is unable to understand this. (CH)

sense.def: understand the contextually determinate object properly

tls:text.tls:line: Even though one may live for a full hundred years,
Even though one may live for a full hundred years,

sense.def: fill out completely (a number of years etc)

tls:text.tls:line: still he is followed by death.

sense.def: passive marker be V-ed by N (note: 被死相隨)

tls:text.tls:line: He is oppressed by old age and illness,
He is oppressed by old age and illness,
He is oppressed by old age and illness,

sense.def: serious lasting disease; sometimes generalised: natural disease, sickness

tls:text.tls:line: He is oppressed by old age and illness,
He is oppressed by old age and illness,
and in the disastrous end he will reach the final limit.

sense.def: serious trouble, misfortune; resulting trouble (from one's actions) 三患"three kinds of disaster"

tls:text.tls:line: and in the disastrous end he will reach the final limit.

sense.def: come to an end, finish; bring things to a close

tls:text.tls:line: and in the disastrous end he will reach the final limit.

sense.def: arrive at, turn up at; get to (a place); abstract: advance to the position of; attain to

tls:text.tls:line: and in the disastrous end he will reach the final limit.
and in the disastrous end he will reach the final limit.

sense.def: outer edge, outer limit, extremity, border-line, limits (often between abstract things like periods of time)

tls:text.tls:line: When old age comes suffering straps the body.
When old age comes suffering straps the body.

sense.def: to reach (a contextually determinate stage or place)

tls:text.tls:line: When old age comes suffering straps the body.
When old age comes suffering straps the body.

sense.def: tie up; put into fetters; entangle

tls:text.tls:line: Day and night there is much pain.

sense.def: during day and night > all day and night

tls:text.tls:line: Day and night there is much pain.

sense.def: there are/were many; be many; be much in quantity, be considerable in extent

tls:text.tls:line: Of sufferings there are a thousand kinds.
like that of fish being put in burning ashes. (CH)
The Yangtse and the Yellow River never stop

sense.def: will never (in generalisations); at no time (during a certain period), never (無有 there never are any)

tls:text.tls:line: They race along and do not turn back.
They race along and do not turn back.
They race along and do not turn back.
One cares for his puss-dripping body,
One cares for his puss-dripping body,
One cares for his puss-dripping body,
but even if he is fond of it he cannot remain in it.

sense.def: remain in the contextually determinate N

tls:text.tls:line: The four great elements assemble into a body.

sense.def: BUDDH: the four basic elements all physical substances are made of (水 water, 火 fire, 地 earth, 風 air) (see also 四界 and 四大界); SANSKRIT mahābhuta

tls:text.tls:line: The four great elements assemble into a body.
Being impermanent, how could they last long!

sense.def: BUDDH: not enduring > be subject to constant change, be impermanent (one of the key terms in Buddhist philosophy; in early Buddhism attributed to all dharmas except space (空) and nirvāṇa 涅槃; ant. to 常住)

tls:text.tls:line: Being impermanent, how could they last long!
Being impermanent, how could they last long!

sense.def: remain in a place for long

tls:text.tls:line: When the element earth breaks up,
When the element earth breaks up,
consciousness is idle and useless.
consciousness is idle and useless.
This body knows many hindrances and troubles,

sense.def: there are/were many; be many; be much in quantity, be considerable in extent

tls:text.tls:line: and, pus-dripping it is constantly struck by disease.
In its foolishness it is attached to sensuous craving.
In its foolishness it is attached to sensuous craving.
In its foolishness it is attached to sensuous craving.

sense.def: colloquial sentence final particle giving emphasis to a judgemental conclusion/apodosis (it seems to used in the way of sentence final 去 or 在 here)

tls:text.tls:line: Though they say of this year: "It is here",

sense.def: OBI: present, contemporary; in the present sequence of days/months

tls:text.tls:line: Though they say of this year: "It is here",
winter and summer do not stay long.

sense.def: for a long time; permanently; in the long run (often postposed); after a long time; in the long term

tls:text.tls:line: winter and summer do not stay long.

sense.def: ZZ 190: be at rest (as still water); stop and rest for a while, come to a stop

tls:text.tls:line: The common man wants worldly happiness,

sense.def: common person; commoner; ordinary person (as opposed to the saint)

tls:text.tls:line: The common man wants worldly happiness,
The common man wants worldly happiness,

sense.def: BUDDH: worldly (as opposed to the higher realm of religious reality)

tls:text.tls:line: The common man wants worldly happiness,
The common man wants worldly happiness,

sense.def: of these vulgar times; of this vulgar world 世俗

tls:text.tls:line: and in the meantime he is not afraid.
Parents and brothers,
Parents and brothers,
Parents and brothers,
wife and child and relatives,

sense.def: family life; family: wife and children

tls:text.tls:line: wife and child and relatives,
wife and child and relatives,

sense.def: relatives, family members (in the Buddhist context occasionally also referring to close disciples; see DISCIPLE); more generally: followers 眷屬諸親 (T.3/179: 450b18)

tls:text.tls:line: impermanence (Impermanence; personified CH) comes to drag them away.
impermanence (Impermanence; personified CH) comes to drag them away.
impermanence (Impermanence; personified CH) comes to drag them away.

sense.def: to come in order to V; come so as to V; come for the purpose of Ving

tls:text.tls:line: impermanence (Impermanence; personified CH) comes to drag them away.

sense.def: drag away the contextually determinate object N

tls:text.tls:line: There is no one who can save them.

sense.def: have the capacity to VERB properly, be constitutionally able to VERB; be physically capable of, be actually able to

tls:text.tls:line: There is no one who can save them.

sense.def: 有巫者: there was a certain NP; there are certain NPs

tls:text.tls:line: The sentient beings are like this:
The sentient beings are like this:
The sentient beings are like this:

sense.def: all the various Ns, (after negations etc.) any of various Ns

tls:text.tls:line: The sentient beings are like this:

sense.def: BUDDH: endowed with sensation > sentient being (as opposed to 無情 inanimate things) (this term for sattva was introduced by Xuánzàng 玄奘 (600-664), although the older term zhòngshēng 眾生 remained more popular; originally both terms were a translation of the same Sanskrit word but eventually yǒuqíng came to be used paricularily for creatures with mental activities, whereas zhòngshēng can be used more generally for 'living being', including plant life; the term yǒuqíng is also less neutral, since it gives also emphasis to the notion of qíng 情, i.e. that living beings (particularily human beings) are characterized by deluded mental activities); SANSKRIT sattva

tls:text.tls:line: With every move they want happiness,
With every move they want happiness,

sense.def: be greedy for, crave, covet; crave for oneself

tls:text.tls:line: With every move they want happiness,
With every move they want happiness,
but in their imperanance stricken by old age and illness,
but in their imperanance stricken by old age and illness,
but in their imperanance stricken by old age and illness,
but in their imperanance stricken by old age and illness,
they create suffering without realizing it.

sense.def: suddenly, before you know it; before you know of it

tls:text.tls:line: they create suffering without realizing it.

sense.def: naturally; without intending the effects one is causing

tls:text.tls:line: they create suffering without realizing it.
they create suffering without realizing it.
He who has taken the tonsure and is a bhiksu,
He who has taken the tonsure and is a bhiksu,
He who has taken the tonsure and is a bhiksu,
ought to cultivate tranquility and insight.
ought to cultivate tranquility and insight.

sense.def: cultivate (one's person, the ancients etc); apply oneself to; train and exercise (troops); occasionally also with negative objects: LH 2 修詐 "cultivate fraudulence"

tls:text.tls:line: ought to cultivate tranquility and insight.

sense.def: arrested>focussed observation> spiritual concentration as a Buddhist method of self-cultivation

tls:text.tls:line: While Māra is unable to waylay him,
While Māra is unable to waylay him,
While Māra is unable to waylay him,
he goes beyhond birth and reaches the other shore.

sense.def: pass through (some number of years etc)

tls:text.tls:line: he goes beyhond birth and reaches the other shore.
he goes beyhond birth and reaches the other shore.

sense.def: reach as far as (not by walking), lead to

tls:text.tls:line: he goes beyhond birth and reaches the other shore.

sense.def: BUDDH: the other shore, further shore (metaphor for nirvāṇa 涅槃); SANSKRIT pāra

tls:text.tls:line: Desire, I know your root!
Desire, I know your root!

sense.def: understand properly; understand and respect properly; be sure of the workings (of something);

tls:text.tls:line: Desire, I know your root!
Desire, I know your root!

sense.def: abstract and metaphorical: root; basis; karmic basis (BUDDH.: orig. tr. SANSKRIT indriya or mūla; see http://www.buddhism-dict.net/cgi-bin/xpr-ddb.pl?68.xml+id('b6839'))

tls:text.tls:line: In my mind you are produced by thoughts.

sense.def: idea, mental representation; an idea of what one is doing, a reasoned plan; See also: plan

tls:text.tls:line: In my mind you are produced by thoughts.
If I do not think of you

sense.def: BUDDH: think; think of (this word is extremely frequent in Buddhist texts, in Taisho more the 7,000 occurrences!)sometimes used in the BUDDH. context more technically: to think and judge on concrete sense data one has perceived; to concentrate on certain thoughts in meditation T.3/186: 503a7 一心專精思惟正義 to reflect about the right meaning with great concentration

tls:text.tls:line: If I do not think of you

sense.def: you (referring to a non-human - sometimes even abstract - object)

tls:text.tls:line: Because of desires afflictions arise.

sense.def: on the basis of 因之（以）, because of

tls:text.tls:line: Because of desires afflictions arise.

sense.def: cause to grow, grow (grain); produce; give rise to; be the origin of, originate

tls:text.tls:line: Because of desires afflictions arise.

sense.def: BUDDH: afflictions; troubles, defilements, contamination (SOOTHILL: 406 "The Chinese interpretation is the delusions, trials, or temptations of the passions and of ignorance which disturb and distress the mind [...].") (The three basic defilements are also referred to as the Three Poisons' of craving/passion (tān 貪 ), anger/aversion (chēn 嗔 ), and ignorance (chi 痴 )) skr. kleśa

tls:text.tls:line: Because of desires fear arises.

sense.def: on the basis of 因之（以）, because of

tls:text.tls:line: Because of desires fear arises.
He who has no fear has no afflictions.

sense.def: BUDDH: afflictions; troubles, defilements, contamination (SOOTHILL: 406 "The Chinese interpretation is the delusions, trials, or temptations of the passions and of ignorance which disturb and distress the mind [...].") (The three basic defilements are also referred to as the Three Poisons' of craving/passion (tān 貪 ), anger/aversion (chēn 嗔 ), and ignorance (chi 痴 )) skr. kleśa

tls:text.tls:line: From biased preferences arise afflictions.
From biased preferences arise afflictions.

sense.def: BUDDH: afflictions; troubles, defilements, contamination (SOOTHILL: 406 "The Chinese interpretation is the delusions, trials, or temptations of the passions and of ignorance which disturb and distress the mind [...].") (The three basic defilements are also referred to as the Three Poisons' of craving/passion (tān 貪 ), anger/aversion (chēn 嗔 ), and ignorance (chi 痴 )) skr. kleśa

tls:text.tls:line: From biased preferences arises fear.
From biased preferences arises fear.
He who is freed from love

sense.def: get away from; get to keep well away from, keep far from

tls:text.tls:line: He who is freed from love
He who is freed from love

sense.def: BUDDH: deliverance; liberation (from defilements and suffering), emancipation; skr. mokṣa, mukti, vimokṣa, vimukti; pali mokkha, mutti, vimokkha, vimutti

tls:text.tls:line: has not fear and no afflictions.
Fruit is at first sweet and afterwards bitter,
Fruit is at first sweet and afterwards bitter,

sense.def: at an early stage; in good time, before it is too late

tls:text.tls:line: Fruit is at first sweet and afterwards bitter,
Fruit is at first sweet and afterwards bitter,
With desire it is also thus.
With desire it is also thus.
Afterwards one experiences hell's bitterness,

sense.def: hellish; deriving from hell, coming from hell; in hell

tls:text.tls:line: Afterwards one experiences hell's bitterness,
Fools cherish their desires.
Fools cherish their desires.
Fools cherish their desires.
They are attached with affection to wife and child.
They are attached with affection to wife and child.

sense.def: family life; family: wife and children

tls:text.tls:line: hard to escape.
hard to escape.

sense.def: find it difficult to V, have trouble (doing something), have a hard time (doing something), find it hard to; be unlikely to (commit an offence one is bound to be punished for); make a fuss about V-ing

tls:text.tls:line: From desire it is hard to be delivered,
From desire it is hard to be delivered,
From desire it is hard to be delivered,

sense.def: be saved from; find salvation from

tls:text.tls:line: but having left desire one truly is somobody who has gone forth.
but having left desire one truly is somobody who has gone forth.
but having left desire one truly is somobody who has gone forth.
but having left desire one truly is somobody who has gone forth.

sense.def: BUDDH: leave one's family > renounce one's family, become a monk

tls:text.tls:line: not desiring one experiences happiness.
not desiring one experiences happiness.
not desiring one experiences happiness.
The wise have no desire.
The wise have no desire.
In the world, people who desire

sense.def: BUDDH: the nether world, this mundane world; the secular world

tls:text.tls:line: In the world, people who desire
are of an unthinkable diversity.
are of an unthinkable diversity.
are of an unthinkable diversity.
When someone is well subdued

sense.def: moderate and attune properly (one''s physical, culinary, and one's intellectual desires in Buddhist contexts)

tls:text.tls:line: he is called someone who has truly left desire.

sense.def: such a person, a person of such a kind

tls:text.tls:line: he is called someone who has truly left desire.
he is called someone who has truly left desire.
he is called someone who has truly left desire.
When someone constantly desires

sense.def: constantly, regularly; continuously; constantly and at regular intervals

tls:text.tls:line: When someone constantly desires
he stays in bonds hard to be delivered from.

sense.def: be located in (a place); find oneself in (a condition, at a time); occupy (a position or an office); place oneself (in a position or place)

tls:text.tls:line: he stays in bonds hard to be delivered from.
he stays in bonds hard to be delivered from.

sense.def: find it difficult to V, have trouble (doing something), have a hard time (doing something), find it hard to; be unlikely to (commit an offence one is bound to be punished for); make a fuss about V-ing

tls:text.tls:line: he stays in bonds hard to be delivered from.

sense.def: find salvation from; deliver oneself from

tls:text.tls:line: Only for someone who can distinguish with wisdom
Only for someone who can distinguish with wisdom
does affliction stop and not arise.

sense.def: BUDDH: afflictions; troubles, defilements, contamination (SOOTHILL: 406 "The Chinese interpretation is the delusions, trials, or temptations of the passions and of ignorance which disturb and distress the mind [...].") (The three basic defilements are also referred to as the Three Poisons' of craving/passion (tān 貪 ), anger/aversion (chēn 嗔 ), and ignorance (chi 痴 )) skr. kleśa

tls:text.tls:line: does affliction stop and not arise.
When right attentiveness constantly arises,
When right attentiveness constantly arises,

sense.def: thought (can be counted and specified! 是念, 一念, etc.), thinking, thought process In BUDDH. texts occasionally used negatively since it refers to the discursive and discriminating mental activities of the mind

tls:text.tls:line: When right attentiveness constantly arises,

sense.def: arise fully, achieve its full development

tls:text.tls:line: when one is quiet, with desire well removed,

sense.def: BUDDH: engage in quiet contemplation/meditation [mod. CH]

tls:text.tls:line: when one is quiet, with desire well removed,
when one is quiet, with desire well removed,
when one is quiet, with desire well removed,
when one is quiet, with desire well removed,
when one is self-restrained according to the precept of the law,
when one is self-restrained according to the precept of the law,

sense.def: prohibitions and precepts in accordance with the dharma

tls:text.tls:line: and does not break them, what is good increases.
and does not break them, what is good increases.
and does not break them, what is good increases.
People who constantly walk in (practise/act on CH) desire
People who constantly walk in (practise/act on CH) desire
associate with fools. (the fools will all cultivate intimacy with them CH)
associate with fools. (the fools will all cultivate intimacy with them CH)

sense.def: all the subjects; the whole lot of the subjects at the same time

tls:text.tls:line: associate with fools. (the fools will all cultivate intimacy with them CH)

sense.def: have improperly intimate relations with; show improper intimacy in interacting with a superior

tls:text.tls:line: associate with fools. (the fools will all cultivate intimacy with them CH)
Those who, atentive and concentrated, are not negligent,

sense.def: thought (can be counted and specified! 是念, 一念, etc.), thinking, thought process In BUDDH. texts occasionally used negatively since it refers to the discursive and discriminating mental activities of the mind

tls:text.tls:line: Those who, atentive and concentrated, are not negligent,

sense.def: be stable and fixed, have taken a fixed shape

tls:text.tls:line: Those who, atentive and concentrated, are not negligent,

sense.def: act in an unrestrained way, be extragagant

tls:text.tls:line: gradually obtain freedom from biases.
gradually obtain freedom from biases.

sense.def: obtain through effort, get hold of

tls:text.tls:line: gradually obtain freedom from biases.

sense.def: BUDDH: purity (i.e. the absence of passions and delusions) freedom from biases

tls:text.tls:line: He who for one moment cultivates tranquility and insight

sense.def: in an instance for as much as an instance

tls:text.tls:line: He who for one moment cultivates tranquility and insight

sense.def: cultivate (one's person, the ancients etc); apply oneself to; train and exercise (troops); occasionally also with negative objects: LH 2 修詐 "cultivate fraudulence"

tls:text.tls:line: He who for one moment cultivates tranquility and insight

sense.def: arrested>focussed observation> spiritual concentration as a Buddhist method of self-cultivation

tls:text.tls:line: can leave all stains of sin.

sense.def: detach oneself from; distance oneself from, become separated from; deviate from; be apart from; leave the realm of so as to transcend; transcend; become detached from

tls:text.tls:line: can leave all stains of sin.
can leave all stains of sin.
His self-conceit is eliminated by itself,

sense.def: BUDDH: self-pride, egotism, arrogance; skr. abhimāna; ātma-mada

tls:text.tls:line: His self-conceit is eliminated by itself,

sense.def: in the natural course of events; naturally; automatically; spontaneously; by itself (without any external initiative)

tls:text.tls:line: His self-conceit is eliminated by itself,

sense.def: be dissolved and removed; get removed

tls:text.tls:line: and, delivered he obtains happiness.

sense.def: BUDDH: obtain salvation/deliverance; be liberated, attain liberation

tls:text.tls:line: and, delivered he obtains happiness.

sense.def: obtain through effort, get hold of

tls:text.tls:line: and, delivered he obtains happiness.
If one does not cut off desire,

sense.def: if; or if (often with implicit subject and without 則 in main clause, and note 若...是 as in 若晉常先，是楚弱也 which has many parallels. Apodosis often )

tls:text.tls:line: If one does not cut off desire,
If one does not cut off desire,

sense.def: cut oneself of from, desist from; abstain from

tls:text.tls:line: If one does not cut off desire,
If one does not cut off desire,
he is like a hide that burns in fire.

sense.def: hide, skin or hide which originally had hair on it or was furry; whole skin of an animal

tls:text.tls:line: he is like a hide that burns in fire.
He burns in a single moment,

sense.def: in an instance for as much as an instance

tls:text.tls:line: He burns in a single moment,
but the punishments he receives are manifold.

sense.def: suffer; be at the receiving end of

tls:text.tls:line: but the punishments he receives are manifold.
but the punishments he receives are manifold.
but the punishments he receives are manifold.

sense.def: quantity; Anzahl; (magical) number e.g. 用六數 "uses the number six; use sextuplets of things".

tls:text.tls:line: O bhiksu, beware of sensuous delight!
O bhiksu, beware of sensuous delight!
O bhiksu, beware of sensuous delight!

sense.def: be wary of, be careful about

tls:text.tls:line: Negligence brings great grief.

sense.def: extravagance; uncontrolled behaviour; lack of restraint

tls:text.tls:line: Negligence brings great grief.
If you forsake desire

sense.def: if; or if (often with implicit subject and without 則 in main clause, and note 若...是 as in 若晉常先，是楚弱也 which has many parallels. Apodosis often )

tls:text.tls:line: If you forsake desire
If you forsake desire
you will with right attentiveness experience happiness.

sense.def: correctly, with formal correctness; exactly, precisely

tls:text.tls:line: you will with right attentiveness experience happiness.
you will with right attentiveness experience happiness.
you will with right attentiveness experience happiness.
Someone who does not know dislike (is never satiated CH), what satisfaction would he know?

sense.def: will never (in generalisations); at no time (during a certain period), never (無有 there never are any)

tls:text.tls:line: Someone who does not know dislike (is never satiated CH), what satisfaction would he know?

sense.def: have got enough of things> be satisfied

tls:text.tls:line: Someone who does not know dislike (is never satiated CH), what satisfaction would he know?
Not being satisfied, how would one know happiness?
Not being satisfied, how would one know happiness?

sense.def: how on earth? How on earth could you/he/I? 回何敢死？ 丘何敢乎？何足憂？

tls:text.tls:line: Not being satisfied, how would one know happiness?

sense.def: joyful satisfaction; state of delight or happiness; joyfulness; joy, delight; happiness;

tls:text.tls:line: When there is lust, what happiness is there?
When there is lust, what happiness is there?

sense.def: joyful satisfaction; state of delight or happiness; joyfulness; joy, delight; happiness;

tls:text.tls:line: Satisfied by calmness and wisdom

sense.def: BUDDH: tranquillity (sometimes used as description of nirvāṇa 涅槃); skr. śānti, pali santi

tls:text.tls:line: Satisfied by calmness and wisdom

sense.def: wisdom BUDDH: (perfection of) wisdom (one of the Six Perfections of a Bodhisattva, liùdù 六度, see also bānrěbōluómì 般若波羅蜜); skr. prajñā-pāramitā

tls:text.tls:line: one can grow in the path without bias.

sense.def: BUDDH: without outflows > untainted, pure, without bias; without contamination (i.e. the absence of passions and delusions) (ant. of yǒulòu 有漏); skr. anāsrava, nirmala, nirāsvara

tls:text.tls:line: If one's desires are not satisfied, [Being greedy, if one is not satisfied,??? CH]
he offends the law and will experience an untimely death. [one rejects the dharma and suffers a mid-life early death.???CH]
he offends the law and will experience an untimely death. [one rejects the dharma and suffers a mid-life early death.???CH]

sense.def: suffer (not quite grammaticalised into the synonym group PASSIVE MARKER)

tls:text.tls:line: he offends the law and will experience an untimely death. [one rejects the dharma and suffers a mid-life early death.???CH]
When one sees physical objects (here: female beauty) one's mind is confused,
When one sees physical objects (here: female beauty) one's mind is confused,

sense.def: Zhuangzi, but later mostly BUDDH: form, matter, physical objects (the object which is perceived); SANSKRIT rūpa

tls:text.tls:line: When one sees physical objects (here: female beauty) one's mind is confused,
and it does not naturally observe its impermanence.

sense.def: in the natural course of events; naturally; automatically; spontaneously; by itself (without any external initiative)

tls:text.tls:line: and it does not naturally observe its impermanence.

sense.def: BUDDH: observe intensively > engage in analytical meditation on

tls:text.tls:line: and it does not naturally observe its impermanence.

sense.def: BUDDH: impermanence (one of the key terms in Buddhist philosophy; in early Buddhism attributed to all dharmas except space (空) and nirvāṇa 涅槃; ant. to 常住)

tls:text.tls:line: The fool takes the beautiful to be good,
The fool takes the beautiful to be good,

sense.def: take it to be the case that S(often in polite speech:) to think (rightly, as in HF 7.2.3) that, to believe that 臣以為，甚以為不然; be convinced that, feel that

tls:text.tls:line: and he does not understand that beauty is not real (and permanent).

sense.def: know that S, understand that S

tls:text.tls:line: and he does not understand that beauty is not real (and permanent).

sense.def: the genuine object, the real object, not a fake

tls:text.tls:line: the fool binds himself with his desires
the fool binds himself with his desires

sense.def: using> by means of, with; by way of

tls:text.tls:line: the fool binds himself with his desires
and does not seek to cross to the other shore.

sense.def: seek to, make every effort to V 求仙 "try to become an immortal" 求及

tls:text.tls:line: and does not seek to cross to the other shore.

sense.def: seek to V (often difficult to distinguish from TRY...)

tls:text.tls:line: and does not seek to cross to the other shore.
and does not seek to cross to the other shore.

sense.def: BUDDH: the other shore, further shore (metaphor for nirvāṇa 涅槃); SANSKRIT pāra

tls:text.tls:line: His longing for riches is a craving,
His longing for riches is a craving,
hurting others and binding himself.

sense.def: to damage, to inflict harm; impair (clear-sightedness) 甚害田

tls:text.tls:line: hurting others and binding himself.
The world contains many marvellous objects of desire,

sense.def: 舉世皆濁 this vulgar world; the world one lives in, this world; Rousseau: le monde; this world versus the other worlds entered by the immortals

tls:text.tls:line: The world contains many marvellous objects of desire,

sense.def: find space for, find room for; have enough space for, be large enough for

tls:text.tls:line: The world contains many marvellous objects of desire,

sense.def: referring to many items GULIANG Yin 4 衛人者眾辭也 "a plural phrase (!)"

tls:text.tls:line: The world contains many marvellous objects of desire,
The world contains many marvellous objects of desire,
The world contains many marvellous objects of desire,
The world contains many marvellous objects of desire,
but these objects of desire are utterly tasteless.
but these objects of desire are utterly tasteless.
If you compare them to the happiness up in Heaven

sense.def: if; or if (often with implicit subject and without 則 in main clause, and note 若...是 as in 若晉常先，是楚弱也 which has many parallels. Apodosis often )

tls:text.tls:line: If you compare them to the happiness up in Heaven

sense.def: if one compares it with; by comparison with

tls:text.tls:line: If you compare them to the happiness up in Heaven

sense.def: compare the contextually determinate object N1 to (something N2)

tls:text.tls:line: If you compare them to the happiness up in Heaven
If you compare them to the happiness up in Heaven
Even if all mountains were completely of gold,

sense.def: all subjects indiscriminately, all subjects without exceptions; without exception

tls:text.tls:line: Even if all mountains were completely of gold,
like the Surrounding Range of Iron,
this would still not bring satisfaction.

sense.def: still; nonetheless; in spite of everything (said in S and not said in S)

tls:text.tls:line: this would still not bring satisfaction.

sense.def: be satisfied with the contextually determinate N

tls:text.tls:line: The perfectly awakened know this very well.

sense.def: the person of correct understanding> the awakened

tls:text.tls:line: The perfectly awakened know this very well.

sense.def: all subjects indiscriminately, all subjects without exceptions; without exception

tls:text.tls:line: Unpleasant retributions in this world
Unpleasant retributions in this world
Unpleasant retributions in this world
are all caused by desires.
are all caused by desires.
A wise man has them well subdued.
A wise man has them well subdued.

sense.def: practise moderation, attune oneself properly to moral/religious requirements

tls:text.tls:line: On this basis one must train onself.
When one has forsaken covetousness and contemplates well,
When one has forsaken covetousness and contemplates well,
When one has forsaken covetousness and contemplates well,
When one has forsaken covetousness and contemplates well,
doubts are removed.
doubts are removed.
doubts are removed.

sense.def: be dissolved and removed; get removed

tls:text.tls:line: Once he rejects that covetousness,
Once he rejects that covetousness,
the tight bond is of itself destroyed.
the tight bond is of itself destroyed.
the tight bond is of itself destroyed.

sense.def: in the natural course of events; naturally; automatically; spontaneously; by itself (without any external initiative)

tls:text.tls:line: the tight bond is of itself destroyed.
Distressed by the net of desire,

sense.def: using> by means of, with; by way of

tls:text.tls:line: Distressed by the net of desire,
Distressed by the net of desire,
covered by the cover of craving,
a foolish being is bound by his negligence, [Those dominated by stupid desires are fettered by their self-indulgence. CH]
a foolish being is bound by his negligence, [Those dominated by stupid desires are fettered by their self-indulgence. CH]
Death and life always pursue him,

sense.def: the destiny of death [not in DCD]

tls:text.tls:line: Death and life always pursue him,

sense.def: constantly, regularly; continuously; constantly and at regular intervals

tls:text.tls:line: Death and life always pursue him,

sense.def: to come in order to V; come so as to V; come for the purpose of Ving

tls:text.tls:line: Death and life always pursue him,

sense.def: exert pressure on the contextually determinate person

tls:text.tls:line: as a calf pursues its beloved mother.
as a calf pursues its beloved mother.

sense.def: go after, chase (deer or fish etc); go in search of (something to eat etc)

tls:text.tls:line: as a calf pursues its beloved mother.

sense.def: loving, fond; sollicitous; characterised by a positive attitude

tls:text.tls:line: as a calf pursues its beloved mother.

sense.def: beloved 愛子 "beloved son" rather than "loving son"

tls:text.tls:line: Those who are covetous and negligent

sense.def: BUDDH: crave so as to get attached to > be appetitively attached to

tls:text.tls:line: Those who are covetous and negligent

sense.def: act in an unrestrained way, be extragagant

tls:text.tls:line: are like monkeys who run into a tree with fruit.
are like monkeys who run into a tree with fruit.
As their covetousness is very great,

sense.def: very much, strongly; also: too much, excessively before VP: very; emphatic after VP: enormously, tremendously

tls:text.tls:line: As their covetousness is very great,
having gone they go again. [Again and again the race along. CH]
Now, when craving is lush,
he will obtain happiness through his right contemplation.
the bhiksu must truly forsake the world!

sense.def: transcend this world, reach enlightenment 超脫塵世為仙。《楚辭‧遠游》："欲度世以忘歸兮，意姿睢以擔撟。" 洪興祖 補注："度世，謂僊去也。"

tls:text.tls:line: can obtain the great happiness.

sense.def: supreme peace of mind> supreme tranquility; supreme serenity

tls:text.tls:line: These circumstances are not brought about by themselves!

sense.def: contrastive: oneself, by oneself[PERVASIVELY DIFFICULT TO DISTINGUISH FROM THE "PERSONALLY npro.adV"] Latin: semet ipse (not semet ipsum!)

tls:text.tls:line: I know for sure that they are not brought about by themselves.

sense.def: contrastive: oneself, by oneself[PERVASIVELY DIFFICULT TO DISTINGUISH FROM THE "PERSONALLY npro.adV"] Latin: semet ipse (not semet ipsum!)

tls:text.tls:line: the fool is intent on vigorously seeking them.

sense.def: using （often: all one's) strength, powerfully, with one's power/strength; with all one's strength 力田 "work hard in agriculture"

tls:text.tls:line: you can obtain the happiness of nirvāna.
you must walk in the happiness of the law!
go to the next world (DS: When one remembers with love the friends and many relatives who went to the next world)
but when happiness is at ats highest, harm is extreme (DS: harm arrives)

sense.def: joyful satisfaction; state of delight or happiness; joyfulness; joy, delight; happiness;

tls:text.tls:line: When one says that happiness is associated with beauty,

sense.def: deep communicative happiness 熱鬧的快樂

tls:text.tls:line: Lenience towards oneself may be used as an example.

sense.def: forgive oneself> be lenient towards oneself (Compare the name of the Tang dynasty poet 袁恕己!)

tls:text.tls:line: He who finds happiness in the law and completely keeps its precepts,

sense.def: feel deeply communictively happy with or in

tls:text.tls:line: is treated with affection and respect by others.
and afterwards one will be born in heaven.
He who is good is born in heaven

sense.def: in Heaven (One might also construe 生天上 as a verb object construction.)

tls:text.tls:line: and after his death, birght in heaven.

sense.def: in Heaven (One might also construe 生天上 as a verb object construction.)

tls:text.tls:line: When one keeps the precepts and obtains happiness,
and upon awakening he is always glad.
he (can) always reach a place of happiness.
and is ready-minded when waking and sleeping, (DS: no matter whether he is awake or sleeping)
This is called the place of happiness.
